pros: I love knowing that I am making a difference in lives every day. The insurance and benefits are absolutely unmatched. Free health, dental, vision, disability and life insurance. Plus an amazing pension.
cons: The work can be difficult and challenging, but I know I make a difference in the lives of others.

job_title: Residential Assistant/Medication Aide in Omaha, NE
pros: The clients are super. They make everything else almost worth it. Free health insurance and it's pretty comprehensive. They do have some good employees working there, but can be far and few between.
cons: Mgmt. is a nightmare. Communication is subpar at best. They did away with raises based on time worked there and the past few years those just coming into the agency make the same as many of those who have been there for 3, 4, and 5 years. Don't look for bonuses or raises based on merit. It's union so the raises are across the board.

job_title: Direct Support Professional in Omaha, NE
pros: Helping the adults with special needs, seeing my individuals everyday, working with my CO-WORKERS. Insurance is great! I have nothing else to say for the pros of this company.
cons: Management is TERRIBLE, poorly trained staff, not being able to put your opinion on anything, trying to stand up for the individuals but ending up getting shut down by the supervisor, terrible attitudes from supervisors and individuals, childish behavior from supervisors, The amount of hourly pay staff receives is NOT Worth it!

pros:
Fair wages
Not too fast or slow paced
Can be a fun workplace if you get along well with coworkers
Eight hour work days as opposed to 12, if you prefer that schedule
Free healthcare and other great benefits
cons:
Often short staffed, so lots of dependency on agency nurses and CNAs who may not be familiar with clients.
Twelve hour work days as opposed to 8, if you prefer 12s
Communication is iffy, but improving
Use of technology is a bit behind other agencies, but this is also improving

pros:
free health insurance (and it's awesome)
casual dress code 
company mission / rewarding work
cons:
very poor management (at the top level) & poor communication (at all levels)
pay isn't great - but about par for the industry 
long hours and odd schedules
lack of training
no teamwork / lack of cohesion 
nothing gets done unless you are the squeaky wheel (and always include the manager's manager)

review_title: ENCOR is very different from any job.
pros: Everyone is very kind and generous. The individuals will brighten your day if you are having a bad one.
cons: You have to be a very patient person.
I haven't found any cons myself
